extendedContent.title: Description and Powers
extendedContent.content:
The Tarnhelm (German: "camouflage helmet" or "concealment helm") is a magical helmet
                    from Germanic legend, most famously featured in Richard Wagner's opera cycle "Der Ring
                    des Nibelungen." This powerful artifact grants its wearer the ability to become invisible,
                    transform into any shape, and teleport instantaneously from place to place.
                
                
                    The helmet is one of the treasures of the Nibelung dwarves, forged using the Rheingold's
                    magical power. In Wagner's version, it was crafted by Mime under the compulsion of his
                    brother Alberich, who used its powers to tyrannize the other dwarves and amass wealth.

extendedContent.title: Wagner's Ring Cycle
extendedContent.content:
Das Rheingold
                
                    In the first opera, Alberich forces Mime to forge the Tarnhelm from the cursed Rheingold.
                    Alberich uses it to enslave the Nibelungen and accumulate treasure. When Wotan and Loge
                    trick him into demonstrating its powers by transforming first into a dragon, then a toad,
                    they capture him and seize both the Tarnhelm and the cursed Ring.
                

                Siegfried
                
                    After Siegfried slays the dragon Fafner (who had used the Tarnhelm to take dragon form
                    and guard the treasure), the hero takes the helmet along with the Ring. The Woodbird
                    advises him of the Tarnhelm's powers, which he later uses in his adventures.
                

                Gotterdammerung
                
                    The Tarnhelm enables much of the tragedy in the final opera. Siegfried, given a potion
                    of forgetfulness, uses the helmet to assume Gunther's form and abduct Brunnhilde. This
                    deception leads ultimately to Siegfried's murder and the cataclysmic end of the gods.
